DOC.brief_summary: Objective . To compare benefit spinal manipulation combine massage therapy versus massage alone patient tension-type headache ( TTH ) frequency , intensity disability cause headache cervical range motion . Method . A factorial , randomize , double-blinded , placebo-controlled clinical trial conduct sample 105 subject diagnose TTH , divide two group : ) treatment group receive manipulative technique follow massage cervical suboccipital region ; ) control group receive massage alone . Four session ( per week ) apply four week . The Headache Disability Inventory ( HDI ) use evaluate change frequency severity headache functional emotional aspect headache . Range upper cervical cervical flexion extension evaluate . Measures conduct baseline , immediately intervention ( week 4 ) follow 8 week completion intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Does Addition Manipulation Provide Added Benefit Massage Therapy Tension-type Headache Patients ?
DOC.detailed_description: MATERIALS AND METHODS Participants The sample consist 105 people diagnosed frequent ( 47.6 % ) chronic ( 52.4 % ) TTH derive two primary care centre , select accord criterion IHS3,4 , suffer headache three month . Participants age 18 65 year ( mean ± SD : 38.9 ± 10.9 year ) , include 23 men ( 21.9 % ) 82 woman ( 78.1 % ) . Patients exclude suspect malignant disease , rheumatoid arthritis , pregnancy , vertigo , continuous intake prescribed medication receive physical therapy past 3 month headache neck pain . Finally , 102 subject complete study ( 2 treatment group drop due work problem one control due lack improvement ) . The software G*power14 calculate require sample size , use data previous study estimate effect size expect . Our review extant literature show across study , mean N 44.28 general large effect size find ( Cohen 's = .40 ) .15-19 We accept 5 % alpha risk ( α = .05 ) 10 % beta risk ( β = .1 ) study parameter show 51 subject require group achieve medium-to-large effect size ( f = .35 ) . We predict 5 % dropout rate follow-up period . Study design The study factorial , randomize , double-blinded , placebo-controlled clinical trial . It conduct January November , 2014 . After initial clinical interview , allocation patient control treatment group randomize external assistant use specific software ( name ) monitor sequence documentation time . Both external assistant therapist examiner blind study objective . Patients randomly assign 2 group ( treatment control ) . The treatment group receive occiput-atlas-axis manipulation ( OAA ) soft tissue treatment massage . The control group receive massage . Thus group receive duration massage therapy exposure time , however difference group lay manipulative OAA technique treatment group receive . Four session conduct ( per week ) assessment carry 3 stage : baseline , end treatment ( 4 week ) follow-up 8 week follow completion treatment . All patient group assess condition treatment examiner blind group allocation . The study conduct University Valencia ( Spain ) January 2014 November 2014 . Prior data collection , inform write consent obtain patient , procedure conduct accord Declaration Helsinki .
DOC.criteria: Subjects age 18 65 year Diagnosis frequent ETTH CTTH Having headache episodes 4 day per month Headache episodes last 30 minute 7 day Headaches least 2 follow characteristic : Bilateral location pain Pressing non pulsate quality Mild moderate intensity Not aggravated physical activity Sufferers may present photophobia , phonophobia , nausea vomit Headache may associate pericranial tenderness Suffering TTH 3 month Subjects pharmacological control • Patients infrequent ETTH , patient probable TTH frequent infrequent form . Headache aggravate head movement . Metabolic musculoskeletal disorder symptom similar headache ( rheumatoid arthritis ) Previous neck trauma Vertigo , dizziness , arterial hypertension . Joint stiffness , arteriosclerosis advance degenerative osteoarthritis Patients heart device Patients process pharmacological adaptation Excessive emotional tension Neurological disorder Laxity neck soft tissue Radiological alteration General hypermobility hyperlaxity Joint instability Pregnancy Received physical therapy treatment headache neck pain previous 3 month Suspicion malignancy
